title: 5-year-old accidentally shoots 7-year-old in leg Saturday in Hanover
content:
HANOVER, Va. (WRIC) — A 7-year-old girl was shot over the weekend in Hanover as her parents looked at a home for sale.
Authorities say around 12:07 p.m. on Saturday, officers responded to the 20000 block of Beaverdam Road in Beaverdam. Deputies found the victim, a 7-year-old child, suffering from non-life threatening injuries from a handgun.
The investigation revealed that two children followed a cat into a bedroom while the family was viewing the home for sale. A 5-year-old child followed the cat under a bed, found a gun and accidentally shot the 7-year-old in the leg.
After hearing a gunshot, neighbor Gary Whitehorn said his girlfriend went to find out what happened.
“My girlfriend had walked over and asked what was going on… Little boy had found the owner’s gun looking at the house,” Whitehorn told 8News. “Accidentally shot the little girl.”
The victim was transported via med-flight to VCU Medical Center for treatment and is expected to be okay.
Investigators are still collecting information and consulting with the Commonwealth Attorney’s Office regarding the circumstances that led to this tragic incident.
No criminal charges will be brought in this incident.
Stay with 8News for updates.
